Reviews.Title: “Excellent base/Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Jordan K
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife stayed here in August 2012 for 3 nights, we booked very late and got a really good price. Hotel is very nicely decorated and furnished, and rooms have great air con, tv (no english channels), and a wall radio (which was great), also have a small drinks fridge which is really handy. We also got a nice suprise to be given breakfast over the road in a neighbouring cafe, it is continental self service breakfast, good qulaity and very tasty, great for the days tourist activities. Check in was a little complex as the woman at the desk spoke virtually no English but we got by. Dont hesitate to book here if your looking for a good base for a tourist holiday. P.S RE the location, 10/15 mins in a taxi from airport 4 stops in the underground from Madrid's main train station, and two minute walk from underground. Tons of bars/eateries all near by (excellent spannish resteraunt (1st on left when walk out hotel). Do not go to eat as much as you want buffet near Sol Square *horrible*

Reviews.Title: “A perfect point to visit Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Giulia80Z
Reviews.Content: The location is really really perfect to visit the city and enjoy the night-life, however without being disturbed by noise. The (included) breakfast in the near cafe is good: it is not a real continental breakfast, but more a Spanish one with bread and fresh tomato / olive oil, a lot of fruits, yoghourt and croissants. The reception is not always open, but you can always ask or phone to the sister hotel (1 min walking). We needed a taxi at 4am, they have (of course) booked it for us, and the reception stayed open for us that night. One more, the hotel, the room and the street especially look much better in reality than in the photos on booking. If I have to say something negative, the internet connection was only by lan. They could give you a cable, but it is not useful if yo have an iPhone or smartphone, when you are on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chaniya_Abimbola
Reviews.Content: Just renovated not long ago, very nice situations, clean rooms abeit a bit small, very decent bathroom and the breakfast wasn't bad for the price. Recomended

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: JANE g
Reviews.Content: I spent there 4 days with my boyfriend. Everything was perfect. The room was small but really nice new powerful shower and helpful staff. Breakfast is served in another hotel. Very good position to visit the city. Plenty of nice restaurants and bar around..The area is a bit noisy during the night. i ll go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy K
Reviews.Content: I´am from travel agency from slovakia. Stay 01.11.-04.11.11. I can realy recomande this small lovely hostal it is smart desigtion for low cost travelers. Hostal is new, clean with helpfull personal, in low season also quiet, with perfect position.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful, a real find!”
Reviews.Author: MerryDevil
Reviews.Content: Given the low price (we booked through Agoda) and the central location, we were very worried that we'd spend four days in a downtrodden hostel. Nothing could have been further from the truth. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom spotless with plenty of hot water. The fourth floor rooms get almost no street noise. The most amazing point, however, was the air-conditioning. We visited during the hot Spanish summer, and yet the AC was perfectly capable of making polar bears comfortable. There were a few minor downsides. We had some initial difficulties at check-in, as El Pasaje's computers were down, and check-in was being handled by a hotel down the street. Reception is frequently unmanned, although an attendant can usually be reached via interom. The elevator is quite small, which meant that we needed to take two trips when moving luggage. At this price point, however, I was a bit surprised to find an elevator at all! Bottom line: stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent; very much a budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rachelproby
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. We did not set foot on the subway. If you are willing to tolerate two things, then this hotel is a great deal. First, the bathroom had an overwhelming smell of mildew. I think I remember seeing this mentioned in other reviews. We kept the door shut and aired the room out periodically. Second, the room is very loud at night. Noise from the street continues into the early morning; noise from other guests coming and going also filters through the door. However, the staff was friendly, and as I mentioned the location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Globally fine”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Belgium
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient, close to the subway and in walking distance of many activities. The reception is ok but not super friendly, they will help as little as possible. The room is perfectly clean, has the necessary furniture and is quite comfortable. Unfortunately, the isolation is quite poor, which makes the room very noisy, from the bars next door and from the corridor. Earplugs should help. The breakfast, to be taken in a close restaurant, is very poor, not fresh and of bad quality. I would advise to go elsewhere. The overall value is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieWindsor
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at El Pasaje thanks to the reviews on Trip Advisor. It is situated on a pedestrian street and we were not bothered by noise. The rooms were small but well organised with a desk, fridge and safe and spotlessly clean and a change of towels every day. The air con was fab which was a great relief in the summer heat! The breakfast at La Levante restaurant was very good and service by staff there was excellent. The receptionist/ maid was delightful. She worked very hard. Nothing was too much trouble for her and she spoke very good English. Great value for money in the centre of madrid. Walkable to the key sights!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: edison074
Reviews.Content: The room is clean, recently refurbished, equiped with Free Internet, Security Box, TV and radio. For the free internet, I obtained the cable from the reception and it is free of charge. Excellent location very near Sol Metro and perfect for sightseeing.I found a bit problem locating the Hotel when I arrived because I didn’t realised that it is so near from Sol Metro. The room inclusive of breakfast and breakfast was is good and exceed my expectation. Just take note that the breakfast is at other hotel (Victoria Hotel) located nearby. Good value of money and I booked the room directly via the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hostel Great City Great Country”
Reviews.Author: GreekGod_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, recently refurbished, very clean, helpfull staff, booked it 3 months in advance, 2 weeks before we arrived price had reduced by 1/3 but we didn't get the reduction (shame) Would return but would leave it late to book Peter & Pauline

Reviews.Title: “Rude stuff, clean and good location!”
Reviews.Author: sufhiboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and breakfast was quite above the average when you compare typical Spanish breakfast. The location is good! These are the positive parts of the hostel! But, there was one girl working in this hostel who can not speak English. She made us so nervous. The problem is not lack of her English capacity but her rudeness! We are gay couple so I wanted a double bed room! She did not understand it we discussed maybe 10 minutes, later she called someone and the man in the phone was helpful. Tomorrow, they gave us double room. But when we wanted to go out in the evening. These girl and two friends were talking in the lobby. They saw us suddenly stopped and did not say even 'hola' = 'hello' although we said. Before I m closing the door of the hostel. They started laughing. I looked back to them with nervous and they stopped again. The other days, the same girl behaviors' did not change! If you are gay, do not go to this hotel. There is discrimination here!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel, clean, comfortable, in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pline75
Reviews.Content: This place is a brilliant find. It's so central, you can step outside and find many, many pubs and bars within a few steps. The metro is just around the corner, so also easy to get around the rest of Madrid. The place is spotlessly clean and our room was cleaned every day. The rooms are small and basic but clean and the decor is fresh and modern. The reception isn't always manned, but we didn't find this to be a huge problem. The breakfast is served at a little cafe/restaurant across the lane, it was basic but we filled up every day before heading out and about, no complaints. All in all a brilliant bargain hotel, great price, great location and clean comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “its just location perfect”
Reviews.Author: horsesireland
Reviews.Content: we are just back from weekend in madrid and we stayed in el pasaje, it was everything we wanted, quaint cosy and above all spotlessly clean, the location could not be better right in the heart of oldtown and within 50 metres of the metro, madrid is a lovely city to unwind for a few days, so many little streets full with restraunts and bars and tappas its so easy to just while away the time strolling at leisure, most of the restraunts we visited were very good although i must stress that on our last day we were looking for something a little bit special to leave a lasting impressikon, so after a fair bit of searching we decided to eat at the restraunt el catedral, well it certainly left a lasting impression but for all the wrong reasons, after an ok starter (croquettes) we had steak for main course, what can i say it should have come served with a chainsaw, it was the toughest skeak imaginable, so after the waiter (nice guy) observed us struggling with our steak knives he promptly took our plates away, twenty minutes later he returned with a load of appologies and two new steaks which if anything were tougher than the previous ones, At that stage we just gave up an left cause we were getting tight for time for the airport, To sum it up we had a truly lovely time in madrid, the hotel location meant we never had to worry at night about getting home cause we had everything on our doorstep so was brill, but final word of warning AVOID EL CATEDRAL!

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget option”
Reviews.Author: stigos
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay smack in the middle of everyting in Madrid, but prefer to spend your money on food, shopping or entertainment rather than on sleeping, this small hostel is the place to stay. Only 200 m from Sol, the centre of Madrid, and with lots of excellent restaurants and cafes in the same area; i.e. lively neighbourhood. Rooms are somewhat small, but quite modern, clean and with a proper bathroom. Service is basic (staff shared with hotel across the street), but friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is served across the street. Some noise during the night; (as you would expect in the centre of Madrid), but otherwise an excellent place to spend your Madrid-days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: a1fie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pasaje is a lovely wee hotel in a great location (very close to Sol). The rooms were modern, clean and, probably most importantly, had air conditioning! We weren't bothered by much noise from outside either, despite building works just opposite, although we were on the top floor. Breakfast is served in a hotel a few doors down and was delicious - lots of choice! The staff at Pasaje were also pretty nice. I woud happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: llpasah
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very pleasant 5 night stay at the Hotel El Pasaje in Madrid. It is located in a small street with a great variety of traditional tapas bars at your diposal, yet only a minutes walk from the busy Puerta del Sol. Whilst the rooms are small, they are clean and very well furnished with fridge, flat screen tv, aircon, safe and shower room. Breakfast is served in the Cafe Levante (Hotel Victoria) at the end of the street which posed no problem at all. Our room was at the back and had no view, but as there is a bar below and one opposite the hotel, it suited us perfectly. However, saying that, even though the bar has several tables outside, it seemed to attract mainly hotel users (us included!) and there was never any rowdiness whilst we were there, (in fact we saw no rowdiness at all in Madrid, despite the crowds) so I would not let this put anyone off booking the El Pasaje as it is in an ideal spot for all that Madrid has to offer. Plaza Mayor is 7-10 minutes stroll and is fabulous as there is always something going on, and a Metro station is round the corner in Sol. I would not hesitate to recomend this little hotel to anyone looking for a break in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: imaresident
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stopped 2 nights at this hotel and found it very modern in a quiet location right in the city centre.we would not hesitate using and recommending this hotel to anybody.

HotelInfo.Name: El Pasaje
HotelInfo.Address: Pozo 4, 28012 Madrid, Spain
